text:
Hey All

Anyone having cache issues?
Im in constant talks with support about this as when i bustCache - the page works
yes always, you bustCache and it works, then reload the page without it and still shows the old version
The work around is always go into your page editor and use the preview link. That will always give you the most recent version without needing to bust cache.
<@U25PYL3Q8> - live content is being cached and the only way it works is if we bustCache or use preview. How do I “uncache” without needing to reach out to support everytime
Help me understand what this page does and the need for uncaching so I can give you a better answer

A temporary fix could be including the `request.cookies` variable on the page. It disables caching.

You don’t really need to do anything with it.

`{% set disable_cache = request.cookies %}`

Hey all
I’m using batch api to update objects in HubSpot. I have noticed that if one of the IDs is invalid (meaning there is no object with that id) the batch succeeds with informative response if any error occurred. Note that the other updates, those with the valid IDs, are updated successfully which is great. Relying on that behavior I can filter invalid data and handle them according to my needs. However, when I send in the batch a property that doesn’t exist (meaning this field was not created in HubSpot), the WHOLE batch fails. My question is how if there is a similar approach for invalid property, as it is with the invalid HubSpot id.
thanks!
Im attaching example of the 2 cases:
That was the last type of option I was going to extend lol, I’ve done with `request.query_dict`
According to the docs query_dict no longer disables cache. At least it doesnt flag it as such. :man-shrugging:
cookies was just the first one that I saw on there that had the flag for it disabling cache.
oh interesting, glad I didn’t message that to Zieyaad lol thanks for the save there
